doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Ravi Gulhati held on November 19, 1985
doc.abstracts: In November 1985, Ravi Gulhati was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert W. Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1956 to 1989, Mr. Gulhati worked in the following areas: in the economics department as an economist (1956-1964), as deputy director (1972-1973), and as director (1973-1976); in the office of the president (1964-1965); in Korea as chief of the World Bank mission (1965-1966); in the development finance companies department as chief economist (1969-1972); as chief economist in both the eastern Africa region (1977-1984) and eastern and southern Africa region (1985-1986). His transcript concerns studies of supplementary financial measures. The proposal of external financial resources to help countries to sustain their development plans in the event of an export short-fall, and his travel to India.
